(AP Photo/Frank Franklin II), 289967=Curry was the first player to score at least 50 points in the Mecca of basketball since LeBron James did it in 2009, and the Warriors' point guard is one of only 14 players who has posted those numbers at the newest incarnation of Madison Square Garden.}
textBeforeTable: The all-time Warriors players with 50 or more points in a game, including playoffs, and how many times they did it: Warriors to score 50 For a lot of teams, 54 points would challenge the franchise record. Thanks largely to Wilt Chamberlain and Rick Barry, Stephen Curry's outburst Wednesday leaves him tied for 78th on the Warriors' all-time list.   Curry will remember that one day, just not right after a loss. "I just thanked him, because I have never been part of anything like that in my life," Warriors guard Jarrett Jack said. It was especially beautiful after the first quarter, when Curry scored only four points on 2-for-6 shooting. He said he started feeling "numb" in the second quarter, consistently sensed that he was wide open and said "time kind of stood still" as he scored 50 points in the final 33:30 and missed only one of his 12 three-point attempts. "He's beautiful to watch," New York head coach Mike Woodson said. "He was huge, just remarkable out there," New York forward Amar'e Stoudemire said. Curry set career highs in points (54), field goals (18) and three-pointers (11). His 54 points represent the most scored by a Warrior since Purvis Short tallied 59 against New Jersey in 1984. Curry set the Warriors' franchise mark with 11 three-pointers, a feat that hasn't been achieved in the NBA since Smith made 11 in 2009. Only five players have made 11 or more three-pointers since 1985-86.
